subject: RE: [junit] Reporting more then 1 failed assertion per test
msgSnippet: ... Doesn t this rather make your testing order dependent, which I believe cannot be guaranteed with JUnit? Why add the number if not? Shouldn t test cases
messageBody:
>
>I use the following naming convention for my test methods to keep
>things organized:
>
> test_##_nameOfMethodBeingTested
>
>For example, the eigth test method for the method isAccountAssigned
>would be,
>
> test_07_isAccountAssigned



Doesn't this rather make your testing order dependent, which I believe
cannot be guaranteed with JUnit? Why add the number if not? Shouldn't test
cases have names that reflect their purpose (a la Refactoring) just as much
as production code? This numbering rather defeats that... And if, say, test
07 fails - what does that tell me? That 01-06 and 08-12 have passed,
and...???





--

* Jim Cheesman *
